website_summaries.verdict: This camera offers auto lighting LED lights to help you at night time. This camera is set to 149° to help combat a deformed image.
pros: Backup camera includes automatic assist guidelines to aid reverse parking
Unit is waterproof with high-temperature resistant lens
Includes appropriate cables to install to your desired monitor
Includes backup parking lines to help aid reverse parking
cons: Some users found the video quality to not be as good as other models

website_summaries.verdict: Strong option for using at night with 8 bright LEDs. Small camera yields better image quality than you'd expect.
pros: Also works as a front view camera
Good customer service, and 2-year product warranty included
cons: You must purchase a display screen separately to use with camera

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera Amazing Costumer Service
customer_reviews.text: As someone who rarely likes to rely on backup cameras, this was surprisingly useful. Very impressed with the backup guidelines as shown in the pictures I backed into a parking spot using only the guidelines and I was perfectly centered in the spot. Only bad feature is that if you have this camera on constant power to view anytime from your head unit, there is no way to shut the lights off on the camera. I reached out to the erapta costumer support and explained this problem and they are sending me the third gen camera free of charge! Hands down best costumer service I have ever dealt with.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Clarity Day or Night
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful camera I'm very impressed took me over an hour or so to replace the old one cuz I had to run all new wiring so I had to take everything out especially the radio to plug into the back of it but once it was installed it was gorgeous I could see everything clear as a bell and the picture quality was most outstanding you will not be disappointed especially the price pick one up today
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this camera to my Pioneer AVH-2300nex in my 04 F150. I haven’t put many road miles on it yet, but initially the camera has a good picture and no color distortion.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Voss

customer_reviews.title: Very good camera, exceptional customer support
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to replace one that came with the monitor I had purchased from another company. The ERT01 is a much better camera. The color is much, much better and is significantly brighter than my old camera. Installation was simple, as the hookup was identical to my old camera. Customer service was exceptional. I had ordered a second unit to use as a front facing camera. This unit was not designed to be used in that manner (forward image was reversed). eRapta sent me the correct camera with no hassle. A simple email to them was all it took. New unit arrived in 3 days. I am well satisfied with the product and the vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Willie

customer_reviews.title: Crazy Thin Wire Gauge
customer_reviews.text: The wire gauge is about 20-22 AWG. Very hard to work with. However, the picture quality seems very clear. Haven't had problems with flickering or any display issues. EDIT: Dropping it another star. The seller keeps spamming me with email, trying to get me to remove this review by bribing me with a full refund if I delete it. EDIT 2: Dropping the last star I can, since they're continuing to spam me via email to remove this review literally months later. Contacting Amazon about this behavior from the seller made no difference, so that's cool.
customer_reviews.author: Seifer44

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend but watch some videos on how to install
customer_reviews.text: Overall I think this is a good product! My only negative issue was the directions were not very clear. An the video aux prong snapped off into my head unit just from fishing the cords thru my cabin. I wasnt pulling it tight but more so just from tucking it into my interior pannel. Video quality for both day an night is 5 stars. Durability 3 stars.. Cords need to be upgraded. I also took some silicone around where the cord goes into the camera fir extra protection from the weather here in utah. But all n all i would recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: L8ke0city1

customer_reviews.title: Discolored after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: I works but its discolored after only 1 month of use. The first picture is the erapta camera. The second picture is my factory rear view mirror camera. As you can see my grass is not purple Ive seen others on here with the same problem and received a REPLACEMENT I would like this fixed
customer_reviews.author: Kyle D.

customer_reviews.title: D.O.A
customer_reviews.text: The camera was dead on arrival, I used a number of different wiring configurations to no avail. I was able to confirm power but still couldn't get a visual. The instructions are a joke or poorly translated from another language. The power hot and ground are too short for an SUV with the plate mounted on the lift gate and the reverse lights on the quarter panel. Also the bracket is too big and covers up your registration stickers.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Despite a few other reviews that said the colors were ...
customer_reviews.text: Despite a few other reviews that said the colors were off and that their greens were coming in as pinkish-purple, I bit the bullet and gave this a try. I just got it installed and unfortunately mine is defective as well. In the photo I've attached you can clearly see the green leaves of the trees behind me are coming in as a purplish tone.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald

customer_reviews.title: replacement model works great!
customer_reviews.text: Update: they stand behind their product and have great customer service. Replaced with a better model at no extra cost. Original review: After the first rain the camera stopped working all together. Wiring for this unit is very low guage and cheap, making wiring in somewhat tedious. The colors that the camera displays are way off. It tends to go go almost black and white if you have the camera activated for a while. Otherwise, there are strange purple and pink hues on everything. Not terribly impressed, but for 20 bucks what can you expect.
customer_reviews.author: Brian N

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Absolutely not worth the effort to install
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't expect much for the price but for how long it took to install it is a COMPLETE waste of time and money. The frame rate is about 1 frame/second so if you want to back up at .25 mph then it may be effective enough for you. The video quality is worse than the flip phone I had back in 2003. All of the colors are so saturated you pretty much can't make out any real objects. Might be a good camera for.... something that doesn't require actually viewing the video...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy will die in 6 months time
customer_reviews.text: This has been working for about 6 months and all of a sudden just a black screen when I put it in reverse. Does that mean the camera died in 6 months time? I had it professionally installed for $110, what a waste. hope someone from the manufacture is able to reach out to me with a resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Sat_Sonic

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this while installing my Pioneer AVH 4200NEX in my 2005 Dodge Magnum. I documented a video on how I installed my stereo from start to finish. On YouTube it's called: Installing a Stereo, USB Ports, and a Backup Camera in a 2005 Dodge Magnum. The backup camera install begins at 53:01
customer_reviews.author: Adam Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Good then went purple/blue
customer_reviews.text: Worked great then went crazy. Greens went to purple pink blue. They sent me a replacement and that camera as well was doing the same thing. They have offered me a new camera different model that cost more. And I accepted it. So for this review of this camera I would give one start all day But customer service on he other hand is awesome. Quick reply’s and very helpful in trying to solve the problem. So 1.) this camera ERT01 is not good 2.) customer service is excellent so I give customer service alone 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: RJolley

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $20 I paid
customer_reviews.text: Like some others, I am not pleased with this product. Just like Flanker reported in his review, the picture is terrible and has a lot of purple, especially the trees. Classic example of " you get what you pay for". I opted to get a $20 camera and this is what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Laughter

customer_reviews.title: Well will the problem be corrected...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item August 27. It's filled with water. Camera was starting to fade now I see water through the display
customer_reviews.author: Melo

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Randomly doesn't turn on. Even tried hot wiring it and had same results.
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: Color is off
customer_reviews.text: It generates a picture, but the colors are not accurate. What should be green shows up as purple. Video from other sources looks fine, so the problem is the camera, not the monitor. I emailed the seller but aside from asking for my order number I have gotten no response.
customer_reviews.author: MtLagunaNed

customer_reviews.title: Rear license plate mounted camera
customer_reviews.text: Works well, easy to install and power up from reverse lights. It can be tilted to a desired position. Can be used with any radio capable of receiving RCA video input.
customer_reviews.author: Juan A. Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd camera in 3 years all have cost around the same price ($30) the last one only lasted 6 months then it just glitched and finally stopped working. I need to hook up my trailers on a daily basis it’s frustrating getting out the truck to check how close or far I am to the ball until it actually hits my bumper. The camera impressed me right away. High quality image during the day evening and night. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The camera works great and the picture is clear and visible
customer_reviews.text: Installed this on the top of my license plate. The wire lengths were not nearly long enough for my 2012 Dodge Grand Caravan, but we had extra wires on hand that were more than adequate to make up the shortfall. Once it was installed, however, it has made a world of difference. The camera works great and the picture is clear and visible, even in the darkest of nighttimes. The picture also has guidelines to show exactly how far we may be from whatever is behind us. If it weren't for the wires being too short for our van, I would give it 5 stars, but as that complicated the install, I can only give it 4.
customer_reviews.author: CeCe Garrett

customer_reviews.title: so far so good. in that i havemt backed into something
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. in that i havemt backed into something. pic is clear - night or day. has held up to rain and car wash. not a knock but fyi - setup is a PITA (4runner). have done a ton of car audio installs - but doing it (properly) required running the wires through my back hatch - under the car - back into the car - under the back seats (which i had to remove) - then to the dash - then behind the headunit. electrical wiring is easy - simply tap the 12v+ on your reverese light + ground + the 12v accessory on you headunit. appearance is very discreet. looks like a normal license plate cover.
customer_reviews.author: rube

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: First of all the description doesn't say or states this backup camera is made entirely of plastic. Guess I can overlook that but when the camera came and I hooked it up. It popped the fuse to my radio. I double checked the polarity on my multimeter and everything fine in the radio side since I wanted a slimmer profile back camera. I plugged the old on it and everything works. Old saying, you get what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Man I really wanted to like this camera and actually bought two for my 2006 ford ranger but the camera pictures look grainy n not clear the back up camera gets lines through it and the front camera the lights for night won’t turn off....just expected the picture quality to be better...consider both cameras had same quality of picture I’ll probably be returning them. I attached photos but it’s hard to see how bad the camera quality is through snapping a photo on my kenwood screen
customer_reviews.author: Niki

customer_reviews.title: Skeptical about low cost items, but pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty specific about my technology items and usually do quite a it of research before hand. I saw that this item was listed pretty well and decided to give it a shot. This was to be use in place of a smaller similarly priced backup-cam and the quality and features of this one are much better than the old one. I was pleasantly surprised about the picture quality, it's crisp and clear and the lights on either side of the camera provide excellent illumination in low light situations.
customer_reviews.author: Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Having no way to disable the lights is lame!
customer_reviews.text: So, the camera works perfectly when hooked directly to positive and negative, and I use the reverse light as a trigger for my radio to switch to the camera, but the camera has these annoying lights that stay on ALL the time. Everyone says to power the camera from your reverse light, however when I do that, the camera's video either has too much interference or just won't work. So there's no way to disable the lights without breaking them. I will be returning and buying a camera with no lights.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy P

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need for a Reverse Camera in a single package
customer_reviews.text: I received the eRapta ERT01 in a single box and was happy to see it included everything I needed, including the video/trigger cable and a beautiful small camera. The instructions were easy to follow and I am happy to say everything worked the first time! I installed the eRapta ERT01 in a '73 VW Beetle which has an Android media center/navigation. The installation was very easy and I am very happy with the quality of the camera. Note the camera actually covers much greater view height than shown on my screen shot because I tucked the camera up under my license plate shroud, which reduces the view.
customer_reviews.author: C2 Review

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately it only works 1/10 tries
customer_reviews.text: Want to start off by saying that I will be reaching out to the seller, in attempts to get a replacement, so we will see how that goes. Anyways, I got it installed and had no picture. Camera cuts on (I can tell by the lights on the camera iteself being on), reverse lights are on, and my head unit switches to camera mode, however there is nothing being displayed. Only one out of every 10 attempts or so give me feed from the camera. I have checked the wiring three times, even rewired the power after the first attempt. Perhaps I just got a defective one, we shall see.
customer_reviews.author: jeflea2768

customer_reviews.title: Great back up camera.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is a good little unit for your car or truck. It has a nice clean picture, though the fisheye lens takes a little getting used to. THE DOWNSIDE! and the reason the four star review; this thing is NOT waterproof. I live in the Northeast of Massachussetts, and though its been a fairly dry summer, the summer rain storms will play havoc with this in regards to dampness. The real test will come during the winter months, though I took some gasket sealer and coated every crack, screw hole and entry way I could find to keep this dry. Will revisit this when I go through the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Donovan Jones

customer_reviews.title: Wife said it was nicer than her factory cam
customer_reviews.text: This camera has nice picture quality. I've had it mounted for about a week and am very pleased with it. Picture is clear day or night. I can still see well even when it's covered in dust. Been through a couple of carwashes too. My only complaint (4stars) is that the trigger wire (power wire) is very thin. It's like bell wire thin. I had to use my fingernails to strip it as wire strippers just kept cutting through it. I taped it up very well so as to minimize it's possible breakage. If this can make it through the winters snow and ice, then all will be good.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for a good price
customer_reviews.text: This camera has really good image quality and the lights on it are REALLY bright. I wasn't thinking when I bought this because the camera I was replacing is powered all the time so having lights on this one means they were on all the time. You can easily disable the lights on this if you make this same mistake. Note that doing so voids the warranty and compromises the waterproof seal. Inside all the wires go to the center where the camera is and a single red and black go down to the lights. Simply cut the red wire going to the lights to disable them.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back up camera to put on my wife's toyota camry. There were many cameras to choose from but this one had good reviews so I took a chance and it seems that I made the right choice. Instruction were a bit veauge but installation was easy enough, pkenty of you tube videos showing how to do it. The camera seems very goid quality and I like how you can adjust the angle up or down. The picture quality is clear, better than the factory camera on my truck. The led lights come on when you reverse which makes backing at night really nice. I am happy with this camera and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: M. Calhoun

customer_reviews.title: If the adjustment could be locked in place it would be 5 star
customer_reviews.text: I live in Montana and the winters destroy ad-on back up cameras. I don't know if water gets inside them in the carwash and then freezes, damaging the unit or what. I had a more expensive version that I loved but like its same predecessor and other It would quit in the winter. So I decided to buy the less expensive model and plan on replacing them every year. The picture quality is good. It is easy to install and adjust. I would have given it 5 stars but there does not appear to be any way to lock it in position once adjusted. It just used the friction of the pivot assembly to hold it in place.
customer_reviews.author: J. Grafford

customer_reviews.title: The best out of 4 that I tried
customer_reviews.text: Day time image is clear, but a little over exposure. It has the best night time video out of the 4 cameras that I have owned/ tried. The night time video does even show color, while other cameras can barely show blurred black and white. Occasionally, the video signal will be lost for a brief 5 seconds at night time. I am ordering another one to try. If the new one does not have the video loss at night time, I will update it to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: WaltAmaz

customer_reviews.title: Good camera, Great Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: I had a slight issue with the camera when I initially installed it. There was a short in the video cable, causing the screen to blank when in reverse. I got ahold of the company and they immediately issued a replacement camera and cable. The backup camera now works flawlessly and is a great addition to my vehicle! Picture quality is excellent and includes the Green, Yellow, Red lines for judging too close/too far when backing up. I am already planning to purchase another camera for my other vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Z.Wright

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brother in law who bought a used Sierra and has trouble parking it. It has helped him park and it was an inexpensive way of getting into the back up camera realm. I've been wanting a camera for my own 2009 Camry but I have been hesitant due to the installation. I don't really want to pay someone $60 to install it because I know I can do it myself but I also don't want to mess up the wiring. This camera is super easy to wire up. About 6 different connections, most of them to the same wire and done. The only annoying thing is wire managent but hey that's all up to you
customer_reviews.author: Raul

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement Camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this back up camera as my previous camera by a different manufacturer failed. It came with all the necessary wires and instructions. All I had to do was unplug the yellow and red connectors, remove the old camera and reinstall the new camera. This one comes on a mount that is perfectly sized to attach using your upper license plate attachment screws which is super simple. It looks a lot better than my old camera that had metal mounts that rusted. This new camera has all nonmetal mounts and looks good ... and won't rust. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Tallen

customer_reviews.title: Works great with aftermarket car stereos with video/backup camera input.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install on the license plate mount. Cable then must be ran from the camera to the car stereo and then a couple of wire connections to the vehicle body and the backup light wire. Produces a great view of behind vehicle day or night. Camera can easily be adjusted up or down. I installed on an older truck with an extended cab and 8' bed, which is typically difficult to see out of when backing up, especially when a camper shell is on. The camera gives me confidence that I am not backing over something.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera. If you have problems with rolling picture or lines, read this.
customer_reviews.text: Good camera, nice picture, plenty of cable, easy install. Requires a SOLID 12 volt power source. I initially tried using the voltage off of my reverse lights and the picture had lines in it if the truck was off and would roll uncontrollably when the truck would run. I was also trying to use this as the reverse trigger for the radio and most of the time it would not trigger the radio to go into reverse camera mode. The measured voltage was 11.55 volts. I used a relay as wired in the attached picture to provide both the camera and sensor with a good 12 volt ACC source and all problems disappeared.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Lower resolution than other VGA backup cameras.
customer_reviews.text: Replace a old backup camera that have gotten sun damage with this one. Little disappointed when I got the images to come up on my head unit. It is noticeably lower resolution than the one it replaced. Everything looks pretty pixelated where as my Boyo camera looked sharp. I had to cut the wiring in order to connect it, otherwise I probably would have returned it. It will certainly get the job done, and on the plus side the colors look pretty good. You get what you pay for sometimes
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii Makai

customer_reviews.title: won't last.  don't buy
customer_reviews.text: After about 4 months the picture got very blurry. I thought at first that the lens was dirty, so I cleaned it carefully with a microfiber towel and windex. That did not fix it. Then it would come on only sometimes. Now it won't come on at all. Before any of you say installation error, I had it professionally installed. Not only would I not spend money on this camera a second time, I think the product is so bad that it actually owes me money for having wasted my time and causing such frustration.
customer_reviews.author: bcb

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install as replacement for my last one!
customer_reviews.text: My Last camera had plastic lenses that. and I had to remove the outer one after a few months. but it kept working for the last 8 years. this new model is such an improvement and i really like the fact that it has lights instead of infer-red. i use this on my 06 F150 for connecting to a trailer and it makes the job super easy and even better with the lights so that i can tell depth better in the Dark. and the fact that the lens it glass should help keep it from scratching up and yellowing out. hope to get another 5- 8 years out of this new model
customer_reviews.author: Justin D Holcomb

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install and Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I bought the eRapta ERT01 2nd Generation Car Rear View Reversing Backup Camera to replace a 3-year old Pioneer Rear Camera that stopped working (turned out to be a wiring problem). I like the license plate bracket and the built-in (removable) backup guides. I have a full-size long-bed Chevy Silverado truck and the camera cable was long enough to work easily for this vehicle. It plugged in and powered up and looks good on the 800x600 Pioneer AVH-4200NEX head unit. Very happy with this reasonably priced camera!
customer_reviews.author: Stuart M. Grant

customer_reviews.title: $25 and quality is great and I chose it over $50 camera!
customer_reviews.text: I’m extremely happy with my purchase. There was another cam for $45 with 720P but I chose this over the 720p quality. Simply b/c of price and the images uploaded is exactly what I’m looking for. The precious one I had was in the shape of the license plate - picture was gray and I didn’t know what I was seeing in the back. This is opposite of that and I’m glad I purchased this. It took only less than 5 mins to install bc the wiring was already done previously. If you have doubt, give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: MRCHIRO

customer_reviews.title: Great picture, iffy quality wiring.
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. Better picture than the factory camera on my wife's 2019 Optima. Only cons are how thin the power wires are. I had to double them over and solder that together to get the smallest set of wire taps I had to work. Which took a multimeter to diagnose. if you don't have the tools and knowledge you may have issues. Also, there's no way to weather-proof your connections unless you have some serious heat shrink. All mine were too small to fit over the connectors. As a side note, this company tries to bribe you for 5 star reviews with "free" gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Three issues
customer_reviews.text: Erapata ERT01 camera has a few issues you should be aware of before you buy. First the led lights stay on “all the time”, not just when your backing up. Second, the wiring sent with the unit was defective. This was discovered after I installed the unit and ran the wire through the car to the rear of a Chrysler Pacifica. Third, about 40% of the time. I put the vehicle in reverse and see “no signal”. After you put the vehicle back in park and then back into reverse the camera will come on. Too many issues for my taste. Returning for a refund and replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel T. Prewett

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as intended
customer_reviews.text: Paired with a Pioneer 6.2" system. This does not flip the video (thank goodness). I installed this in a Toyota Camry and I have been very satisfied so far. The tilt adjustment allowed me to angle the camera exactly where I wanted. The distance lines on the video also help me gauge how much space I have when I back up to a concrete wall at work. Installation took a few hours but it wasn't difficult to run the wire back to the trunk and out to the license plate.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Good value and good quality
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this camera and finally installed it a year later when my truck was down for a week. Unsure if the cable it came with was long enough since I had ordered extra cable and everything had gotta mixed up. I would say it's a pretty good camera, I had to flip it around for it to mount how I I want. I feel my license plate light or my led reverse lights affect the camera LEDs making it really bright when backing up at night but gonna try and cover the LEDs to see if it makes a difference. I'm using the backup lines from the camera, not my stereo but it's surely not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Now I can see what’s directly behind me
customer_reviews.text: It took a bit to figure out how to install it on my Nissan NV1500 but I finally figured it out. It’s a fairly medium to low resolution camera but it’s more than adequate as a backup camera. I can tell the difference between gravel and dirt, between a leaf and a rock and certainly if something is in the way or if the terrain drops off. At night it’s a pretty good image as well. In my case I could not mount the camera on the upper license plate bolts because of the way the door overhangs the plate area. Because of this when it rains, water collects on the lens. Other than that very happy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sanfilippo

customer_reviews.title: Great backup camera
customer_reviews.text: Installed on a 2006 GMC Yukon, with an alpine iLX-007 Apple CarPlay It took my husband and I, from start to finish about an hour to install. Most of the time was spent removing the taillight and drilling a hole to run the wire to it. Everything we needed to install it was in the box, with the exception of the tools. I read the reviews prior to purchasing & for around $20, I figured I’d give it a shot, and I’m glad I did. Currently considering purchasing one for my husband’s truck as well. I definitely recommend this backup camera.
customer_reviews.author: MommaJen

customer_reviews.title: Camera has water in it after 6 weeks of use
customer_reviews.text: Excellent back up camera for the money. The image quality is decent to good in comparison to high end cameras but again for the money you can’t go wrong!.....update the camera now has water in it and I was basically told I’m out of luck because the return window has closed after 30 days. I won’t be buying this camera ever again that’s for sure... I will make sure to inform everyone also.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great camera 👌
customer_reviews.text: One of the better cameras I've used on my double din display. Built-in lines to show you how far you are from any object you're backing up to. I did have the camera get foggy after almost a month of none stop rain here in the south but the company stands by their products and customers. They walked me through a few trouble shooting steps and once they determine that the camera had failed they replaced it with a new one. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: R. R. Lopezlazo

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly good quality
customer_reviews.text: I’m normally skeptical about a $30 camera, but I figured there’s not much to lose. Well after 8 months and a Michigan winter I think it paid for itself by now. Excellent he picure and even night vision. Only thing I don’t like is the style. Nothing wrong with the product, but the license plate location gets dirty often and morning exhaust blocks the view. Too low. Much easier to use this location, but a trunk mount would work better
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a 19 year old truck that had a severe blind spot with backing up. I was able to integrate the eRapta product with a new console radio/nav/bluetooth device, and it worked perfectly. Mounting the camera was easy and I had no difficulty tapping the power sources, which is no small fete with Nisan Trucks because their back up lights are wired like the Star Ship Enterprise's engines..ie. "Like A 1950 Christmas Tree" . You don't need to be an auto mechanic or an electrician to install this..the instructions are very clear.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Becker

customer_reviews.title: It was good for about a month - then it leaked
customer_reviews.text: As we speak the camera is no longer in use after only about 6 weeks of working. The "Waterproof" camera leaked and quit working properly. We have had a lot of rain but this has not been immersed in water nor has it been pressure washed. I bought it because of the reviews and, sadly, it did not work for me and has been replaced with a tailgate mounted camera. I will take my chances with one that claims to be water resistant instead.
customer_reviews.author: N. Jocoy

customer_reviews.title: Great for new drivers
customer_reviews.text: We installed this in my sons 2008 Nissan Altima along with a new radio. He just got his drivers license so we thought this would be a great option to assist him when backing up. The grid lines do not move like most newer vehicle backup cameras do, but still assists him with knowing how close he is to objects. There was an issue with the wiring not matching the instructions, however my husband is handy so was easily able to figure out the problem and fix it. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tara P

customer_reviews.title: Very poorly made.  Broke almost immediately.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this. It worked, though since the camera gives you no way of knowing which way is up, the picture was upside down. In the process of reinstalling it, something must have broken because it stopped working. Wasted day, which I am very irritated about. I was hoping to buy another one for my wife’s car, but I’ll be going with a different model. Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: R. Weiler

customer_reviews.title: Died after 4 uses.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for 3 months and it already died with about 4 uses. Since Covid, I don't drive my truck much. This worked great on install and for a day after when trailered my boat. Now it is hazy and not working at all. The lights come on, but the picture is completely distorted. Unusable Update: response was quick, they sent a replacement unit and it got here in 3 days. The replacement is dirty and used. It has dirt built up in the back and screw with surface rust. Obviously used for a while. 3rd update. Replacement died after 1 month. Based on other reviews this is normal.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: The safety, quality, and price of this item make it worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera for a great price. Wide field of vision makes getting used to the guidelines a little different, but I like this camera much better than the factory installed one on my wife’s car (Volkswagen). Wiring was a breeze but there are plenty of videos on YouTube if you aren’t familiar with car electronics. *Helpful Hint* This camera is also extremely useful if you live in a city where heavy interstate traffic is part of your normal daily commute. If wired properly you can play your music and still have the camera on screen for a much better view of what’s going on behind you than just what your mirrors can show.
customer_reviews.author: John Hogg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent video quality
customer_reviews.text: Installed reverse camera in 2008 Toyota Sequoia. Video quality is really great. Installation is very simple. Built quality of the product is good. Only issue I faced in Toyota Sequoia is, the rear window that rolls down damaged the cable. The camera has a PCB molded in the cable and this circuit board got damaged while opening and trying to solder new cable. Anyway I placed order for new camera and I need to be more careful while routing the cable.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Requires a garganuation hole to install
customer_reviews.text: Maybe this is a good camera but I was not able to install it due to the fact that has two full-sized plugs and some bulky thing in the middle of the cable. Note that you are required to snake this cable to the inside of your car to connect it to your stereo/display. I was replacing an existing camera which had a very fine cable which I was able to snake through the license plate lite socket easily. But this one would require a hole of 1/4" - 1/2" and I am not going to drill something like that in my car. Back it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Its okay i guess
customer_reviews.text: The back up camera does what it is supposed to do but not that great. The camera has serious issues in light which causes it to appear very dark. But at night or places that are kind of dim/shade it works well. I have it on my 05 civic ex and its really helpful. It can help give you that extra sight you need when getting into those tight parking spots. Be careful though because the camera and how far you are from the object is sometimes tough to tell until you get used to the distance and how far you are from the object behind you.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Easy Installation
customer_reviews.text: This must be the best value backup camera available anywhere. The picture is perfect, and appears bright on the screen no matter what time of day it is. in my case, I was replacing a factory backup camera on my car that is over 10 years old. The camera had become foggy overtime and was useless. I simply cut the wires on the old camera and spliced them onto the corresponding wires of this new camera, and it worked beautifully right away. I am shocked at how high-quality this camera is for such a great price.
customer_reviews.author: megawally

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are simple and straightforward
customer_reviews.text: I really like how simple the directions made it to install. The fact that it has slotted holes for mounting, makes it easy to adjust, while also allowing it to be used as addition support for holding up the license plate. Camera and picture quality is impressive for what it is. With the LED's, it's not your typical "night vision", but damn does it work well. So far I am very happy with this product. Having it out in the rain/snow will be the next true test.
customer_reviews.author: Hallday007

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well, RCA wire was long enough ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well, RCA wire was long enough for my longbed F250. Power wires were the cheapest wiring I've ever seen possibly 26 gauge my 24 gauge stripper barely scraped it. I ran my own wires most of the way and just used a small pigtail of there's that'll atleast reduce the resistance. Need to get a new pigtail with decent wires.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product.  Worth every penny. Very easy to install yourself.
customer_reviews.text: I used the camera to replace another camera on my Honda CRV. I really liked how simple and easy it was to install, and that it came with all the necessary accessories for universal installation. I really like the quality at day and night, even though, I would have preferred a cleaner look at nights. I really like the wide scope of view that it gives. The price is excellent and it saved me alot of money because I was able to install it myself.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Awsome
customer_reviews.text: Added to upgraded Android Stereo in 2002 Dodge RAM. Stiff neck, really helps avoiding your vehicles at Walmart... Clear lines adapt with turning and stop marks are rite on the money. Thinking of using to up grad the old camera on the 1999 RV.
customer_reviews.author: Parabike

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install - I would recomend this light to anyone installing a back-up camera
customer_reviews.text: The instructions included were not only precise but easy to understand in my native language English. On my '09 Highlander the wire to hook into is the white one. They even included the perfect install clip to make it a professional installation. The 149 dig view angle is perfect and has no distortion. You can use this camera with any head unit as the guide lines are selectable and can be turned off or on. The included backup LED lights are a nice touch also. The tech support people where easy to understand and very helpful should you need them.
customer_reviews.author: WestEnd

customer_reviews.title: Great picture and customer service
customer_reviews.text: Worked great and amazing picture...better than stock on my wife's van. After 2 months the screen looked like it did above however the company sent me a replacement even though I was outside of the return window. Wonderful customer service and the new camera works great. One of the reasons I chose this product was ease of replacement if I did have a problem. I don't need to rewire everything because the quick disconnects next to the license plate make the swap simple. New product works great. I added a little hot glue around the wire and case seam on the camera as I suspect the rain may have gotten inside.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan B.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money this is garbage I have no idea why it's listed as bestseller
customer_reviews.text: I hooked us up properly just as the instructions suggested got it to work great It worked for about 2 minutes then the video started to get all blurry and hazy then the signal went no signal came back on all blurry and hazy no signal kept doing that a couple times finally stopped working all together and never turned on since ripped it off the truck smashed it with a sledgehammer felt better ordered a new one from a different company.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: really wanted to love this.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera maybe 6 months now..when first installed I loved it, when summer hit, rain and heat took it's toll. It's not sealed almost at all. Water has gotten into the camera. Humidity intensifys it causing the camera to fog up terribly. Even when it dries out the inside of the camera still contains little specs of water drops witch can be seen on the screen. Really wanted to love this but I'm disappointed overall. Not even a year of ownership
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Great wide angle view and bright backup light
customer_reviews.text: Edit: The seller made it right with me by sending a camera that doesn't have the light. This item works great if you can connect the power line to your backup lights. Original: I've purchased many of this style cameras and never have I had one with a bright light that's always on. If had a way to connect it to my reverse, I suppose it would be fine...but need a camera that's on whenever the key is on. It's a problem at night because the light is so bright I'd be afraid I'd get pulled over. I could see a value in the bright light if there was a way to control it independently of the camera sensor.
customer_reviews.author: Traffas

customer_reviews.title: Seems good so far
customer_reviews.text: I used on 2004 suburban. I was concerned that it would be too short. It was plenty long for me to rout however I wanted. Also it has the power wire in the monitor coax so you don’t have to run separate. The power wires are very small and hard to work with. Routing the wire is prob the toughest part and that’s up to you. Also locating the reverse light power is tough. I added a small wire to reach up to the reverse light but you may be able to find it right by the license plate. Overall easy. Don’t know about how durable yet as I just hooked it up. Works well
customer_reviews.author: Jim buss

customer_reviews.title: didnt work
customer_reviews.text: it didn't work and i was foolish and waited too long to make the return. Overall sad product. Lot of work drilling holes and running wires back for something not to work. Customer service on the website is an intentional maze with no way to contact any body to get to for tech support so i threw in the towel.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Bermuda

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work all that great and went back to my old camera
customer_reviews.text: From day one the camera was fuzzy and had white lines in the picture. Then it would just stop working and I’d have to go and unplug the video feed and plug it back in for it to work but it keeps shutting off. I swapped it with a broken one that I had and the picture was perfect so I think the camera was defective from when I got it. It was cheap so I’m not worried about it but it’s disappointing that it didn’t work since day one basically
customer_reviews.author: Wesley

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement for previous back up cam with white LED reverse lights to help the camera see
customer_reviews.text: This items simply works. Easy install onto license plate screws or automotive double sided tape for mounting onto steel plate off road bumpers. The only problem I had was the looseness of the camera tilt. I did not see way to be able to adjust tension, so I just used a little bit of a shoe goo/ E6000 type of non-permanent adhesive to fix in desired position. Clarity and field of view is as expected.
customer_reviews.author: WallyMonkey

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have only 1 complaint. The video feed has interference and I can't get rid of it. I don't think it's the camera's fault though. They sent me a brand new one for free because I emailed them about the video interference but it is the same thing. I tried a filter and a rectifier and neither fixed the interference. But the camera has a nice feed with engine off and they have great service. SO 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great image and excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Installed on my older expedition to help my teenage daughter park. Install was pretty simple. I like that you can adjust the camera angle without having to unbolt or use shims. I had an install issue, sent an email to the address that came in the box. They replied instantly and after a couple back and forths, my issue was resolved. Also like that I didn’t have to drill holes to install!
customer_reviews.author: eoddavid

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a quality unit but instructions would be great!
customer_reviews.text: I'll update this after installing but first and foremost vague to non existant instruction. A couple you tube videos set the wiring straight but for a novice with back up cameras the signal wires make no sense. Not until you see that one end just ties in with your positive connection at the reverse light and the other to your stereo signal wire. Additionally the power wires are very small gauge.
customer_reviews.author: kmills

customer_reviews.title: Returned! Has LEDs and is not hidden well enough.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping that this was going to be a great camera but it has two issues for me. There are white LEDs on it and with mine hocked up to my accessory power, the camera is always on which causes the LED lights to be on all the time. I need it to be this way so that I can still access the camera while am driving. I would also so it’s not as hidden as I wanted it to be. I have ordered their other camera that hides the metal behind the license and it’s doesn’t have those stupid LEDs
customer_reviews.author: G. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Great camera at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! The picture quality is better than I expected for the price range (attached picture was while it was raining and with the protective film still on the lens) and I’ve used it from early morning to early evening without a problem. It seems like a pretty solid camera and installation was pretty straightforward. If I am in the market for another one, I wouldn’t hesitate to buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: alag

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality and Clarity!!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved everything about this camera, after install. It operates flawlessly with absolute clarity! I couldn't be happier. Thank You so much for such a great camera. I have small children and, i back into my driveway, so this is so very important that it works correctly every time. I installed mine myself, and although it took some time to do it correctly, i am very pleased with the results. Please do not hesitate to buy this back up cam today! -Mike -Vernon CT-
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: My first complaint is that the Instructions could have been a little better. Was confused if the red wire from the camera and the red wire from the long cable both needed to be connected to the reverse light (the answer is yes they do). The gauge of the wire is also very thin. But overall once installed, I was pleased with the camera and its performance. Now after having the camera installed for a few months it has stopped working completely. My head unit switches to the camera when I put the car in reverse and I get the warning message about surrounding objects, but no video displays.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, not cheap
customer_reviews.text: I have installed these cameras on two different cars now and both have worked flawlessly. The first one I installed was over a year ago and I have had zero issues. The kit has everything you need including wires that were long enough for my GMC Envoy XL with wire to spare. Even though it is an inexpensive camera it is not cheaply made and holds up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie

customer_reviews.title: Great product would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is definitely not the best out there but at this price point I bet you anything it’s hard to beat you can’t expect much for 24 bucks I didn’t expect much when I bought it the picture quality is better than I was expecting at this price point good product would buy again only complaint which the wires were a little bit thicker so it was easier to work with
customer_reviews.author: isakswings

customer_reviews.title: Ok for price
customer_reviews.text: I didn't pay a lot ($20) so wasn't expecting a lot. It's decent for the price point and offers sufficient view and lighting. If you're looking for a $100 camera, this isn't it. If you're looking for functional, this will do. The folks who talk about the wiring being so small don't know electronics. If it had heavier gauge wiring, it would carry a greater current and burn out the camera. It's not a bad option for most.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky72

customer_reviews.title: Replacement works good
customer_reviews.text: My first -generation backup camera needed to be replaced due to water in the lens area. My mechanic installed the new eRapta 2nd generation license plate back up camera in May 2020 (he had installed the first one also). It worked great for one week then stopped working. I got the old one back out and unplugged the new one and plugged the old one back in and it worked. So it wasn't the wiring. I contacted eRapta and they sent out a replacement right away! It's working great (its been a week). It's so wonderful to have it back working again. I use it to hook up my trailer.
customer_reviews.author: J McCallum

customer_reviews.title: wider view, greater clarity
customer_reviews.text: this thing is great. much clearer and a much wider view than the camera that came with my stereo. seems to be of pretty good quality as well so i doubt ill have to change it out due to failure. even if you dont need a new camera, i recommend giving this a shot, because unless youve got a really good camera then chances are this will improve you view while backing up.
customer_reviews.author: jevans592

customer_reviews.title: Great view day or night
customer_reviews.text: Just right for a backup camera with a great picture day or night. Really like the ability to adjust the camera up or down, unlike other backup cameras I have had before, which gives me exactly what I needed. Instructions are a bit hard to follow but there are YouTube videos available to help along. Overall, easy install for a wired backup camera. Wish I had bought this one for my Dad’s car.
customer_reviews.author: G. K.

customer_reviews.title: Don't Trust Them
customer_reviews.text: When I received my Camera, it had a FREE GIFT VOUCHER for a Monitor or 3 Post Cigarette Plug BUT ONLY if you gave them 5 Stars and Wrote A Good REVIEW. So, if they have 5 Stars, they've been Bought. I Don't Trust Them and will not write a good review, just to get a New Monitor. There are others out there.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold George

customer_reviews.title: Very good, value priced camera for backup video in car.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made, very reasonably priced camera for use in backup video systems for cars. It comes with a licence plate mounting, power cord, long video cable, and instructions. I tested it with a 12 vdc adapter and my TV. Works great, and the LED's are very bright, which is helpful when backing up at night. Overall, I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Techie

customer_reviews.title: Works great...until it doesn’t...Great Customer Service.
customer_reviews.text: - Update: Seller contacted me after this review and offered a replacement or option for another model. Although this model leaked in my case (uncommon?), the seller backs up their product! Increased my rating from 2 star to 5 based on customer service. Worked great for first couple months, but moisture got in and could only see two drops with distorted picture. Cleaned exterior with no luck. Took apart and cleaned out moisture; droplets gone, but picture still distorted. Now have to rewire whole thing with something that will work more than a couple months.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: good little camera
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mother. she's getting older and not able to back her escalade up as easy as she used to. I updated her car stereo at the same time because the factory cd player stopped working. she's gotta have that Lionel Richie. anyways the camera hooked up to the new head unit with ease and works great. picture is good and she loves it so it's a winner in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Hemingmyway

customer_reviews.title: Works well - in warm weather
customer_reviews.text: I live in Seattle - doesn't really get cold here, but rains all the time. Camera seemed to work fine. Went on a trip to Whistler, and the camera stopped working in the cold weather. Took a week or two before the picture started coming back on the rear view camera. Would suggest in warm climate / if you have a garage to park your car in. Would avoid if you live somewhere cold!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Birmingham

customer_reviews.title: It's a descent BU cam for the money
customer_reviews.text: I installed this backup camera on a 2008 Mercury Grand Marquis. The camera comes with all the wiring you need to get it hooked up. Unfortunately mine did not come with any directions. Also, the wire is very thin with only a few strands of copper... can break easily. Other than that, image quality is descent and everything works. This kit is a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Saint04

customer_reviews.title: Does not like rain.
customer_reviews.text: No matter how i wire this camera in my gti with a pioneer deck- the led lights never turn off when car is on, and the camera will stop working after a few minutes. Picture quality is good, but i am very unhappy with it. EDIT: 6/24/2020- Rained hard where I live. Car was in driveway, not driving through rain. Camera no longer works. I have the back up lines, and a very blurred picture. Yes, I cleaned the lense. Its horrible. Shouldve sprung the money on a more expensive one.
customer_reviews.author: stephen hanning

customer_reviews.title: Exceptionally good for the very low price
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to find such as high quality product, long enough cable for a 20 feet van, image very bright, in fact so bright that you may want to adjust it to less brightness. Very easy installation, comes we more than is needed to install it, like a very nice power lighter switch in case you want to use it vs. connect it to the rear backing up light. And believe it or not, there it even comes with a very valuable gift offer.
customer_reviews.author: J. G.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install very clear.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Easy to install, it took about an hour because I installed it on a Pick up. I did a Corolla and I was done in about 30 minutes. The one on my Corolla has been working for 2 1/2 years flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Product works well
customer_reviews.text: I installed this camera soon after purchase. Due to the width, I had to cut some of the mounting ears off on each side as not to hide licens place registration stickers. This is not a fault of the product, just how it worked out for me. The picture quality is good and the night vision actually works better than the backup lights on the vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. Great picture. Easy install.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on my Toyota Sienna when I put in the Pumpkin 8.0 android radio, which is phenomenal by the way. The installation was straight forward. The camera is very clear. It has lines that show distance to objects. It also has bright LEDs that illuminate everything behind you when backing up. My only issue is that I needed to extend the writing by a few feet due to having to run it through the hatch and around some obstacles.
customer_reviews.author: Travis M

product_meta.title: eRapta ERT01 2nd Generation Car Rear View Reversing Backup Camera Automotive with 149°Perfect View Angle 8 LED Lights Night Vision 9 Level Waterproof Universal Car Backing Camera License Plate
product_meta.description: Backup camera reverse camera reversing camera for car pickup vehicle
feature_bullets: ►Car Rear View Camera Apply to Voltage Range From 12-24V DC Power ,With Flexible Vehicle Comatability 8M longer High Purity Copper,this is a License Plate Backup Camera without Monitor
►Car Dash Security Sensor Camera of Waterproof Rubber Ring Which is Made From High-Rurity Resin,With International Standard IP 69 Waterproof Property
►Car Reversing Backing Camera with Adjustable Lens Of Camera Find Best Position,149°Perfect View Angle Design Sure See Enough When Parking Cars
►Auto Backup System Vehicle Backup Cameras With AUTO-Lighting LED Lights Make Your Night Driving Much Safty
►Backup Camera for Car,Pickup Truck,SUV,Minivan,Tractor,Trailer and Sedans.Reversing Camera/Rear View Camera/Parking Camera.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars7,335 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
